video.question: Do autistic people usually eat differently?
video.transcription: So this is something that I am very up and down with.I think for me it shows up in the waythat I have certain safe foods.So I think the best way to describe it isa lot of the time, if I'm just going about my life,if I'm doing normal things,then I have a fairly normal relationship with food.I think there's certain textures that I would always avoid.Anything that's a bit, I dunno, slimy or strange,but I think if there's a lot going on in my lifeand everything else feels unpredictable,then I don't have the energy left to dealwith food being unpredictable either.So for example, if I've fallen out with a friendor if I've got really busy week at work,or if there's a lot going on, that all feels unpredictable.So if I'm then to eat a piece of fruit that might be crunchyor might be a bit soggy, that uncertaintyand that not getting what I expect is goingto tip me over the edge.So I tend to have certain foods that I know are always goingto give me the same thing.Like a chicken nugget is always goingto be a chicken nugget, A bagelis always going to be a bagel.It's quite predictable what you're going to get.It's less risk of that being the one thingthat's going to tip me over the edge.So even if I can't predict if my friend's going to fall outwith me, if my project's going to go well at work,if I'm going to be tired from doing something, I still knowthat a bagel is a bagel.And I think a lot of autistic people have these kindof safe foods that they return back towhen things feel like a lot.I think another thing that we strugglewith is getting the signals from our bodies.So whereas a normal person might get a natural signalof being hungry, my body kindof doesn't naturally tell me that.So if it's lunchtimeand then everybody else is eating, then I kindof get the signal from everybody else eating that, oh,it's lunchtime, I must be hungry, I should eat.But if I am maybe alone at home, not around other peopleand I don't have that structure,then I won't naturally think to eat.I can just go and go and goand then suddenly think, ohmy goodness, I've not had any lunch.So I think the way the food that we eat can be more unusual,and I think the way that we know to eat can needreminders from the outside as well.
